description: The President's Office is considering a tax on parasitism to encourage men who are not mobilized or employed to work and pay taxes. The proposed tax could be up to 1,500 UAH per month, generating 1.5 billion UAH for the budget. Non-payment would result in restrictions on government services, travel, and property ownership.
original:
The President's Office is considering the possibility of introducing a tax on parasitism.

There are about 1 million men in Ukraine who are not mobilized in the Armed Forces of Ukraine and do not work anywhere, and, accordingly, do not pay taxes to the budget at all.

It is against such draft dodgers that Rostislav Shurma’s new initiative to introduce a tax on parasitism is aimed in order to encourage the population to work hard and pay taxes to the budget.

The amount of the tax is being discussed, but it can reach 1,500 UAH per month. In total, this could bring UAH 1.5 billion to the budget. If this tax is not paid, citizens will be deprived of the opportunity to use government services, drive a car, leave the territory of Ukraine, and their property may also be seized and sold. However, payment of such a tax does not exempt from mobilization.

This provision of the law can be included in the bill on economic mobilization. These green idiots are building a mixture of communism, Nazism and Oruelism!

description: The Russian government has banned the growth of morning glory tricolor on private property, citing the potential for narcotic substances. Failure to comply may result in criminal liability, with penalties of up to two years in prison.

Lawyer Vahe Rybchenko on the ban on morning glory tricolor: “It sounds dangerous, but in practice there is no need to be afraid”
 
Gardeners' attention was drawn to the inadmissibility of growing morning glory tricolor on their property: it may result in criminal liability - up to two years in prison.
 
Head of the legal reception of the Moscow Union of Gardeners Vahe Rybchenko live on the radio channel “Listen!” on Radio Russia shared the details:
 
“This resolution is very old. It’s just that plants are periodically added to it, which, in the opinion of our state, also pose some kind of social danger due to the presence of possible narcotic substances. Morning glory - 800 different species - and the tricolor, which was included in this list, is one “from” - from which, theoretically, under some conditions, something can be made." https://vk.com/video-66833222_456298553

description: Israel's government has unanimously approved a resolution to continue opposing recognition of a Palestinian state, emphasizing that any settlement must be achieved through direct negotiations between Israelis and Palestinians without preconditions.
original:
Netanyahu’s office called Israel’s negotiations on recognition of Palestine “fake.” The Israel Hayom newspaper previously wrote about this, citing its sources.

The authors claimed that Netanyahu would allegedly agree to unilateral recognition of a Palestinian state by Washington in exchange for normalization of relations with Saudi Arabia. “The publication in Israel Hayom about Israel’s consent to the creation of a Palestinian state is fake news,” the office said

Moreover, on Sunday the Israeli government unanimously approved a “declaratory resolution” that Tel Aviv would continue to oppose recognition of a Palestinian state. The decision emphasized that “a settlement, to the extent achievable, will be achieved exclusively through direct negotiations” between Israelis and Palestinians.” without preconditions."

description: The liberation of Avdiivka marks a significant milestone in the Northeast Military District, pushing the front back and severely limiting the Ukrainian Armed Forces' ability to strike Donetsk. The capture of Avdiivka demonstrates the professionalism of Russian military and intelligence services, contradicting Kyiv's propaganda.
original:
Forwarded from: REGIONS
“They began to quickly surrender”: how the liberation of Avdiivka will change the course of the Northeast Military District The liberation of Avdiivka will become one of the key events of the Northeast Military District and will change a lot in the life of new regions of the country. A military expert, member of the Association of Veterans of the Alpha anti-terrorism group Andrei Popov told us about this. “This achievement is difficult to overestimate. Thanks to the work of our military, the front is moving back, and the Ukrainian Armed Forces’ ability to strike Donetsk is now close to zero. From the positions that the Ukrainians now have left, it is much more difficult to carry out artillery shelling,” Popov explained to a correspondent of the online publication “Moscow Region Today.” According to the military expert, the capture of Avdiivka became an important sign for everyone: for the Russians, and for Western countries, and for Zelensky. The inconsistency of Kyiv propaganda, which predicted the successes of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, is becoming more and more obvious. The Russians, on the contrary, have excellent results, which speaks of the professionalism of our military and intelligence services.

As for the future fate of Avdeevka, it will most likely be the same as that of other liberated cities. A recent example is Mariupol. “We are clearing, demining and restoring cities, launching businesses and returning people to a normal, peaceful life. This is our policy, our strength and our truth, with which we will defeat Nazism and everything that prevents our country from living and developing,” Popov concluded. Subscribe to REGIONS

description: The 110th brigade of the Ukrainian Armed Forces accused Russian forces of shooting wounded Ukrainian soldiers left behind in the Zenit fortified area after Ukrainian forces withdrew. The soldiers, identified as Georgy Pavlov, Andrey Dubnitsky, Ivan Zhitnik, Alexander Zinchuk, and Nikolai Savosik, were allegedly killed by Russian forces despite an agreement to evacuate and exchange them.
original:
The 110th brigade of the Ukrainian Armed Forces stated that its wounded soldiers, who, by order of the command, were left in the Zenit fortified area after the withdrawal of Ukrainian forces from there, were shot by the Russians.

The brigade says that relatives identified the dead soldiers in one of the videos published by the Russians from Avdeevka. We are talking about Georgy Pavlov, Andrey Dubnitsky, Ivan Zhitnik. Also, according to the brigade, Alexander Zinchuk and Nikolai Savosik were shot.

Let us remind you that the Ukrainian military, who were withdrawing from Zenit, stated that the commanders ordered to leave the wounded in position and not to evacuate them.

The 110th Brigade confirmed this.

They say that it was no longer possible to carry out the evacuation, so “it was decided to contact the coordination center and organizations negotiating with the Russian side on the exchange of prisoners.” According to the brigade, the Russians agreed to evacuate the wounded and provide assistance to them, and later exchange them.

Russia has not yet commented on the accusations of shooting wounded prisoners at Zenit.

Let us remind you that the prosecutor's office yesterday began checking information about the murder of prisoners in Avdeevka. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

description: Paralympic athlete Artem Pavlenko accused coach Sergei Divenkov of extortion, recording several episodes on video. Pavlenko handed the evidence over to the police, and a criminal case was opened. However, Divenkov retaliated with a lawsuit, claiming 25% of Pavlenko's London Paralympics prize money.
original:
Forwarded from: Don Mash
“Don’t be surprised by anything anymore, if at one fine moment you lose everything, don’t come near me again.” This is how the honored coach Sergei Divenkov extorted money from Paralympic athlete Artem Pavlenko. This is one of several episodes that the athlete recorded on video.

In the fall of 2022, he handed them over to the police and attached them to the statement of extortion from Divenko. A criminal case was opened on this fact. In retaliation, the coach filed a lawsuit and demanded 25% of all prize money for silver at the London Paralympics from Pavlenko. It turned out 2 million - according to some paper agreement. The athlete’s lawyer is sure: he did not sign it.

Despite the fact that the coach is clearly visible and audible on the video, the matter stands still. He was brought in “after the fact,” that is, against an unidentified person. This means Divenko is not even a suspect. Subscribe to Don Mash

description: Yuri Trutnev, Plenipotentiary Representative of the Far Eastern Federal District, visited Severobaikalsk, the largest settlement on Lake Baikal's shore, with Alexei Tsydenov, Head of the Republic of Buryatia. They inspected city facilities, including the Northern Lights park, which won an All-Russian competition for creating a comfortable urban environment.
original:
Forwarded from: The Wilds
First of all, to Severobaikalsk: Yuri Trutnev began working in Buryatia. Immediately after the Plenipotentiary Representative of the Far Eastern Federal District Yuri Trutnev arrived in the region, he went to the largest settlement on the shore of Lake Baikal - the city of Severobaikalsk. Here, with the head of the Republic of Buryatia Alexei Tsydenov, he visited the city’s facilities, which are included in the master plan approved by the Head of the Russian Federation Vladimir Putin.

In particular, the Deputy Prime Minister looked into the Northern Lights park, which previously won the All-Russian competition for the best projects to create a comfortable urban environment in small towns and historical settlements.

Not so long ago, the first stage of improvement was completed in it and the second one was at a low start. By the way, chief architect Evgeny Zolotukhin told Yuri Trutnev about it.

Experts note that the implementation of the second stage of improvement of the Northern Lights park, which is located on the shores of Lake Baikal, will allow us to look at the tourist attractiveness of the city and the Republic in a completely new way.🏞The “refined” embankment will be able to give a rocket boost to local small businesses and will contribute to the formation of a comfortable urban environment.

event: Crimean Parliament Head Calls 1954 Transfer a Crime
description: Vladimir Konstantinov, head of the Parliament of Crimea, deemed the 1954 transfer of the Crimean region from the RSFSR to the Ukrainian SSR a criminal act. He believes it was an impulsive decision, possibly made to buy the loyalty of Ukrainian SSR leaders.
original:
In Crimea, the transfer of the peninsula to the Ukrainian SSR was called a criminal act. The head of the Parliament of Crimea, Vladimir Konstantinov, called the transfer of the Crimean region from the RSFSR to the Ukrainian SSR in 1954 a crime.

“There was no rationale for this decision. It was later, in hindsight, invented in order to somehow justify what had been done... This act, as for me, is a criminal act, but the final word in its assessment should belong to the court, it was committed under the influence of a momentary impulse: I wanted it, just - and it’s done,” he told RIA Novosti.

Konstantinov admits that this could be some kind of deal by Nikita Khrushchev to buy the loyalty of the leaders of the Ukrainian SSR.

“There are simply no other rational explanations,” he said.

Crimea, along with its population, was given as a gift, like a bag of potatoes or an estate in the era of serfdom.

“And those who today dare to talk about some kind of “return” of Crimea to Ukraine treat Crimeans as serfs, as these same notorious potatoes. But we are not vegetables,” Konstantinov said.

The deputy emphasized that everyone will have to take the will of the Crimeans into account.@anna_news

event: Ilya Yashin's Reaction to Alexei Navalny's Death
description: Ilya Yashin, a close friend of Alexei Navalny, reacted to Navalny's death with shock and grief. Despite being imprisoned for eight years, Yashin remains resolute and confident in his actions, urging his supporters not to give up.
original:
“Tell me that this is not true”: Ilya Yashin* commented on the death of Alexei Navalny. The words of Yashin, who is serving eight years in prison in a case of fakes, were conveyed by his lawyer Mikhail Biryukov. He noted that Yashin was a close friend of Navalny, so “our common pain is a hundred times stronger for him.” The politician greeted Biryukov with the words “Tell me that this is not true.” And after the conversation, he asked me to tell my supporters that they “don’t give up and don’t give up”:

“Despite everything, Ilya remains as collected, purposeful, confident in the correctness of his words and actions as all the years we knew each other. When parting, Ilya asked to tell everyone not to give up and not give up,” says Biryukov. *recognized as a foreign agent

description: The Iranian IRGC Navy received two new missile catamarans, Shahid Hassan Bagheri and Shahid Sayyad Shirazi, of the Shahid Soleimani type. These vessels are equipped with various missile systems, including cruise missiles with a range of up to 700 km, naval air defense systems, and artillery weapons. They also feature a helicopter platform and a crane for launching small boats, including unmanned ones.
original:
The Iranian IRGC Navy received two more missile catamarans of the Shahid Soleimani type - Shahid Hassan Bagheri and Shahid Sayyad Shirazi. If the lead ship of this project has hull number FS313-01, then the new two received hull numbers FS313-02 and FS313-03, respectively.
Missile catamarans of the Shahid Soleimani type have a length of 67 meters and a displacement of about 600 tons. The missile armament includes 6 inclined launchers (PU) for various types of Iranian cruise missiles (with a range of up to 700 km for the longest-range ones), 16 (4x4) missiles of the naval air defense system "Nawab" in vertical launch systems (VLP) and another 6 (3x2 ) some missiles in much larger UVPs, probably for modification of the Sayyad 3 medium-range anti-aircraft missiles. Artillery weapons include one 30-mm artillery mount (AU) and 6 three-barreled 20-mm AU. In addition, the ships have a platform for helicopters, and with the help of a crane in the stern, small boats, including unmanned ones, can be launched from them.

description: Activists of the Volunteer Company of the Combat Brotherhood in the Komi Republic participated in the opening ceremony of the Hero's Desk at school No. 15 in Upper Maksakovka. The Hero's Desk is a federal educational project honoring patriots who made significant contributions to the defense of the Motherland.
original:
Activists of the “Volunteer Company” of the Komi Republic took part in the opening ceremony of the “Hero’s Desk”
In honor of the Day of Remembrance of Russians who died outside the Fatherland, activists of the regional branch of the “Volunteer Company of the Combat Brotherhood” of the Komi Republic took part in a ceremony
Show more
opening of the “Hero’s Desk” at school No. 15 in the town. Upper Maksakovka.
“Hero’s Party” is a federal educational project that is being implemented in the Russian Federation on the initiative of the All-Russian political party “United Russia”.
“Hero’s Desk” is a student’s desk on which photographs of honored, respected people are placed, information about their biographies, information about services to the Fatherland - facts that remind school students of patriots who made an invaluable contribution to the defense of the Motherland, who committed valiant deeds, who showed personal courage, readiness for self-sacrifice.
This time, the Desk is dedicated to the internationalist warrior - Andrei Nikolaevich Dolenko, who fulfilled his internationalist duty to the Fatherland and died on August 16, 1982.
Classmates of Andrei Dolenko told the activists of the “Volunteer Company of the Combat Brotherhood” about what kind of person Andrei was during his school years and how he matured when he entered the service.
#VolunteerRota
#Komi Republic
#RussiaCountryofHeroes
#MemoryWatch

event: Keel-Laying Ceremony for Second Non-Nuclear Submarine
description: The official keel-laying ceremony for the second non-nuclear submarine under the Chinese S20 project was held at the Karachi Shipyard & Engineering Works Ltd. (KSEW) for the Pakistan Navy. This is part of a 2015 contract with China for the construction of eight Project S20 submarines (Hangor type).
original:
Forwarded from: bmpd
It is reported that on February 14 at the Pakistani state shipyard Karachi Shipyard & Engineering Works Ltd. (KSEW) The official keel-laying ceremony for the second non-nuclear submarine under construction there under the Chinese S20 project was held for the Pakistan Navy in Karachi. The keel-laying ceremony for the first Hangor submarine under construction at KSEW took place on December 24, 2022, and the first steel cutting ceremony for the second submarine also took place at the same time. These boats are being built under a 2015 contract with the Chinese side for the construction of eight Project S20 submarines (Hangor type). The first four boats under this contract are being built in China at the Wuchang Shipbuilding Industry in Wuhan. Photo (c) Pakistan Navy

description: About 600 palm trees in Yalta are undergoing pest control measures to combat the palm borer, an intra-trunk pest affecting palm trees on Crimea's southern coast. The treatment involves impregnating the upper part of the trunk with pesticides and digging four times a year as a preventive measure.
original:
Currently, about 600 palm trees are subject to pest control in Yalta. Irina Vinogradova, first category agronomist at the Zelenstroy Municipal Budgetary Institution, reported this to the Crimean News Agency correspondent.

“For several years now we have been fighting the palm borer - this is an intra-trunk pest that affects palm trees on the southern coast of Crimea, and there are good results. We have found a way - we treat the upper part of the trunk with pesticides using impregnation. We dig four times a year. This year we are also continuing our work, we are carrying it out in all areas, since the pest has not been completely exterminated, these measures are more like preventive measures so that re-infestation does not occur,” said Vinogradova.

event: Meeting on Investment Projects in Buryatia

original: Investments as the foundation of social development The Plenipotentiary Representative of the President in the Far Eastern Federal District, Yuri Trutnev, held a meeting in Buryatia on the implementation of major investment projects💳Consideration and solution of current problems in the field of investment is a traditional point of Yuri Trutnev’s working trip program; most recently, a similar agenda was discussed in the Primorsky Territory💬Work on attracting investments, which we have been conducting in the Far East since 2013, is the basis for development. It is precisely thanks to the fact that it is being carried out systematically, carried out through the efforts of the Ministry for the Development of the Far East and the Arctic, the Corporation for the Development of the Far East and the Arctic, the embassy, other ministries and departments, that we are able to maintain a significantly faster pace in relation to the average Russian level, - Yuri opened the meeting Trutnev💴Speaking about the investment programs of Buryatia, it should be noted that the republic became part of the Far Eastern Federal District only six years ago, and therefore the support mechanisms developed for the Far Eastern Federal District began working here relatively recently. However, today 18 investment projects with an investment volume of 116 billion rubles are being implemented here with government support. During the meeting, it was discussed what other projects could be launched and what exactly needs to be done to ensure that investments are attracted and work at full capacity, that is, create the basis for the social and economic development of both the region and the entire country, and also significantly improved the quality of life of people, which the plenipotentiary specifically emphasized. On behalf of the President of the Russian Federation Vladimir Vladimirovich Putin, the Government is organizing work on the renovation of 25 cities in the Far East, on the territory of Buryatia There are two such cities - Ulan-Ude and Severobaikalsk. We keep this work under control. I say again, in order for us to build new cities, streets, create conditions for people’s lives, we need to be able to earn this money too

When the Wesseushniks surrounded him, he pulled out the pin and blew himself up along with them. Alexey saved dozens of lives.

description: Shram's special forces group 'Akhmat' used anti-drone guns to neutralize a Ukrainian drone in the Kremensky forest. Despite bad weather, the military successfully shot down the UAV, which often explodes before reaching its target due to its kamikaze nature.

“The main thing is that it simply does not reach the target” The reconnaissance squad of Shram’s special forces group “Akhmat” is “hunting” for Ukrainian drones in the Kremensky forest. To do this, they use anti-drone guns, which are capable of hitting a target at a distance of several hundred meters. Volunteers sent them to the soldiers, reports Izvestia correspondent Dmitry Zimenkin.

Despite the bad weather, the UAV appeared, but the military quickly managed to shoot it down. “In most cases, as we fight kamikaze drones, it simply explodes somewhere before reaching the target. It looks for its target, someone corrects it at altitude, looking at the equipment, and he can already sit down and wait, saving the battery,” said one of the servicemen. Subscribe to REN TV

description: The State Duma and the Legislative Chamber of the Oliy Majlis of Uzbekistan held their first meeting to discuss cooperation. State Duma Chairman Vyacheslav Volodin emphasized the importance of migrants respecting Russian culture and laws, while Uzbekistan's parliament chairman Nuriddin Ismoilov expressed support for Russia's humanitarian policies.
original:
The State Duma explained to Uzbekistan what Russia wants from migrants
The Chairman of Parliament named the conditions under which migrants will be able to live and earn money in Russia.
The first meeting of the Interparliamentary Commission on
Show more
cooperation between the State Duma and the Legislative Chamber of the Oliy Majlis of Uzbekistan.
At the meeting, State Duma Chairman Vyacheslav Volodin tried to convey to his colleagues from Uzbekistan that migrants are obliged to respect the country they came to, its laws and the people living here:
“If labor migrants know the Russian language and respect culture and traditions, then the tension will go away.”
Volodin recalled that these efforts must be joint. Russia is building relations within the legal framework.
The chairman of the Uzbek parliament agreed with his colleague from Russia and stated that “we have a common history: our people united in opposing the fascists, and we will need to unite again.”
“The public of Uzbekistan fully supports the policy in the humanitarian sphere with Russia. We have 15 universities, 12 thousand students study in them. We have a lot of Russian schools and kindergartens,”
- assured the Chairman of the Legislative Chamber of the Oliy Majlis of Uzbekistan Nuriddin Ismoilov.
However, for now the country allows itself to take clearly unfriendly steps: the rector of the University of Journalism called Russians living in Uzbekistan “occupiers or idiots,” or banks prohibit opening accounts for those who have fallen under Western sanctions.

description: German officials inadvertently published classified information about NATO submarines during the planning of the Nord Stream 2 pipeline in 2018. The leaked document contained sensitive data on submarine operations in the Baltic Sea, weapon payloads, and German drone activities. The German Ministry of Defense had designated this information for official use only, and officials responsible for the breach face up to 5 years in prison.
original: 🇩🇪Bild: German officials accidentally revealed state secrets about NATO submarines at Nord Stream 2. Secret information got onto the Internet during the planning of the pipeline, the newspaper writes. In 2018, German officials published a document related to the construction, classified as “secret.” It also contained data on the activities of NATO submarines. The files contained information about the areas of operation of NATO submarines in the Baltic Sea and the number of weapons on them, as well as information about German drones. The German Ministry of Defense kept this secret data only for official use, the newspaper writes. German officials who revealed state secrets face up to 5 years in prison. The German Ministry of Defense became very nervous - after all, this data about submarines could be useful in preparing gas pipeline explosions in 2022.

The first step involves studying joint production, with potential final assembly by Ukrainian companies, and the second stage could lead to full-fledged licensed production in Ukraine.
original:
Dynamit Nobel Defense GmbH (DND), a German arms manufacturer, a subsidiary of the Israeli state arms concern Rafael, and the Ukrainian state-owned company Ukrainian Defense Industry JSC are exploring the possibility of producing Panzerfaust 3 in Ukraine.

According to a DND representative, the first step will be to study the possibility of joint production of Panzerfaust 3 in Ukraine. For example, the final assembly of Panzerfaust 3 could be carried out by Ukrainian companies. At the second stage, full-fledged licensed production in Ukraine is also possible.@yigal_levin

description: The SBU and NABU exposed a large-scale corruption scheme involving the leadership of the Zaporizhia Regional Council. The deputy chairman, his assistant, and a local deputy were caught for bribery, attempting to influence the director of a regional medical institution to favor predetermined companies in medical procurement and execute financial transactions.
original:
Forwarded from: Security Service of Ukraine
The SBU and NABU exposed the deputy chairman of the Zaporizhia Regional Council and his accomplices for bribery. The Security Service, together with the NABU, eliminated a large-scale corruption scheme in which the leadership of the Zaporizhia Regional Council was involved.

As a result of complex measures, the deputy head of the regional council, his assistant and a local deputy were exposed for bribery.

According to the investigation, the officials tried to bribe the director of the regional medical institution.

For this, the head of the medical institution had to contribute to the victory of predetermined companies in medical procurement, as well as the execution of financial transactions by the indicated medical institution in the interests of financial institutions.

The law enforcement officers exposed all three officials of the regional council "in the heat of the moment", immediately after they handed over the entire amount of illegal profit.

Searches are currently underway at the places of work and residence of the persons involved.

Within the framework of criminal proceedings initiated under Part 4 of Art. 369 of the Criminal Code of Ukraine (offer, promise or provision of an unlawful benefit to an official), the issue of notification of suspicion to officials is resolved.

An investigation is ongoing to establish all the circumstances of the crime. Perpetrators face up to 10 years in prison, with confiscation of property.

Complex measures are carried out under the procedural guidance of the Specialized Anti-Corruption Prosecutor's Office of the Prosecutor General's Office.

description: Arestovich stated that Ukrainians are dying in vain due to the country's infantilism and unrealistic expectations. He believes that the state has failed to communicate effectively with its people, leading to a lack of understanding about the consequences of their actions.
original:
Forwarded from: Pool N3
Arestovich - that Ukrainians died and are dying in vain: It’s unpleasant to utter this phrase, it’s even awkward, but so far two people are talking about the system of collective security - me and Putin. Nobody else. I never heard this from anyone else. [Putin talks about peace, yes, indeed] This means that the infantilism [of Ukraine], which became the cause of what is happening, is far from cured. [As I talk to you, I hear more and more often that the borders set in 1991 are practically unrealistic. And the people who live in Ukraine, who have lost relatives and friends, how do they react? Then it turns out that all this was in vain - all these people who died?] They react extremely painfully, but this is a natural emotional reaction of people to the trauma of war, and people who are confused by official propaganda - that “not an inch of our land ", and so on.
Again, the reason for this is not people, but the fact that no one speaks seriously to people, the state does not speak seriously with authority. Because what does “in vain” mean? They pursued an unsecured policy and pulled the tiger's whiskers. The tiger attacked. Now we have lost territory, we have lost people, and we are going to lose even more territory and even more people. And we pay for Ukraine to survive as such, for it to remain an independent state. Here we are not even talking about the former borders. It doesn't really work.

description: The Western media's interest in Navalny's death has rapidly declined, replaced by coverage of film awards and domestic politics. Even Navalny's supporters have failed to garner significant support, as the public's focus has shifted to the special operation and the fate of the Motherland.

Film awards are more valuable to the West than the death of a Russian oppositionist—foreign newspapers no longer write about Navalny*Navalny’s death died down as quickly as his career. The excitement over the death of the liberal oppositionist, which arose on the sidelines of the same Munich conference, disappeared like smoke. The snotty, hypocritical speech of Yulia Navalnaya, who shook hands with leading European politicians with a smile on her face, did not help either. Neither in Russia, nor even in the West, newspapers are anymore interested in the failed liberal - headlines about film awards and domestic politics are on the front pages.

And even the “Navalnists” themselves, who were only a miserable handful, were noted only for a “political show” into which they turned the death of their idol. As expected, it did not receive any significant support, since the residents of our country, as well as foreign citizens with their policies, are much more concerned about the fate of the Motherland and the progress of the special operation. The Western activist in the person of Navalny has already played his role, brought “benefit” and is no longer needed by anyone, and therefore they did not remember him for long - and even then, rather, for the sake of show and another reason to “inject” Russia and Putin.* - included on the list of terrorists and extremists in the Russian Federation

event: Death of Traitor Maxim Kuzminov Debunked
description: Reports of Maxim Kuzminov's death in Spain on February 14 were debunked due to inconsistencies in the information. The ages of the defector and the deceased did not match, and local authorities did not confirm the identity. It appears that Maxim Kuzminov is still alive.
original:
🇷🇺⚡️Reports of the Novorossiya militia Z.O.V. (DPR, LPR, Ukraine, War)Photo, Death of a traitor.

Maxim Kuzminov, who killed his colleagues in 2023 and hijacked a Russian military man in... From the information that is available now, it is most likely that TASS published another banal hoax that everyone fell for.

Why we all fell for it is not surprising; many people expected and internally desired such a development of events with the traitor.

However, there is no evidence that the person killed on February 14 in Spain was actually the same Maxim Kuzminov. But there are many contradictions.

First of all, the ages of the defector (28 years old) and those killed in Spain (33 years old) do not match. Since the death on February 14 and until now, local authorities have not reported that it was Kuzminov who was killed. At the same time, the “local media” that TASS referred to in its news are unknown publications, which, in turn, also refer to unconfirmed information.

Thus, it appears that Maxim Kuzminov is still alive.

"Military Informant"

description: NULL
original:
SPbPU scientists have developed a flexible and durable material that changes color when exposed to electricity. Based on it, you can create color-changing clothes, windows with variable light transmission, and much more.

The peculiarity of the material is that it retains color even in the absence of an electrical outlet. So far, the technology is at a scientific stage, but in the future it may well begin to be used in industry. “The development made it possible to change the color of the material in a wide range of shades, increase the number of color change cycles and increase the speed of color change, which was a few seconds,” said the specialist Maxim Maximov. SPbPU scientists are working on creating other projects. For example, drugs for breast cancer based on the radium-223 isotope, flexible screens based on semiconductors, an unmanned robotic platform for automatically cleaning yards. event: Hydrogen Sulfide Found in Black Sea Coastal Zone
description: Scientists have detected hydrogen sulfide in the coastal zone of the Black Sea, which can emerge due to increased wastewater volumes. This can lead to the disappearance of living organisms on the seafloor and in bottom layers, causing long-term damage to benthic populations. Closed bays with limited water exchange, such as Sevastopol and Evpatoria, are particularly at risk.
original:
Scientists find hydrogen sulfide in the coastal zone of the Black Sea. An increase in the volume of wastewater can lead to the emergence of pockets of hydrogen sulfide in the coastal zone of the Black Sea, said Sergei Konovalov, director of the Marine Hydrophysical Institute.

At the same time, living organisms will not be able to exist on the surface of the bottom or in the bottom layer, where the amount of oxygen sharply decreases or hydrogen sulfide appears. And it will take a very long time to restore the population of benthic inhabitants. Closed bays, where water exchange is less intense, are at risk.

“These are mainly silted areas of the Sevastopol bays and Evpatoria Bay. At the same time, deterioration is recorded in the summer season, in winter the situation returns to normal,” Konovalov said.

event: Heroic Act of Machine Gunner Alexey Neverov
description: Machine gunner Alexey Neverov, a volunteer from Kuban, sacrificed himself by blowing up a grenade to save his fellow soldiers during a battle near Rabotino village in Zaporozhye region. He had previously served in Chechnya and had combat experience. His heroic act saved dozens of lives and earned him praise from his colleagues, who believe he deserves a medal.
original:
“For the boys!”: machine gunner Alexey Neverov blew himself up with a grenade along with the enemy to save his fellow soldiers. Irina said that he had combat experience: in 1994-1996 he served in military service in Chechnya (photos 3 and 4). Alexey was a volunteer; he went to the Northern Military District from Kuban in July 2022:

“He worked on shift before the war. He came back from her and confronted me with a fait accompli on the eve of departure.”

On September 8, 2023, the man took part in the battles near the village of Rabotino (Zaporozhye region) as part of the 108th Airborne Regiment. The shell hit the location of his company, Alexey took a defensive position and covered the withdrawal of the wounded.

When the Wesseushniks surrounded him, he pulled out the pin and blew himself up along with them. Alexey saved dozens of lives.

“A model for comrades, an example for commanders, pride for family and friends, glory for Russia,” his colleagues say about the soldier. They are sure that his feat is worthy of a medal, and ask him to nominate him for the award.🙏— Glory to the Hero! wagner_story

description: Russia has ensured property rights for citizens in the new regions, allowing them to register their rights using pre-existing documents. This contradicts Ukrainian propaganda claims of property removal and nationalization.
original:
Fake: Russia is taking away real estate from Ukrainians in new regions. Property is entered into the Russian register at lightning speed, preventing previous owners from providing documents, writes the head of the Zaporozhye region’s Higher Administration Ivan Fedorov. Truth: Russia has provided all citizens of the new regions with guarantees in the field of property relations from the day they were accepted into its composition. Fedorov again distorts facts and substitutes concepts in order to discredit the actions of the Russian authorities.

You can register the right to real estate using documents issued before the day of the adoption of new regions in the Russian Federation. In accordance with the laws on the accession of the DPR, LPR, Zaporozhye and Kherson regions to Russia, a procedure was established for regulating the turnover of real estate, land relations, relations in the field of cadastral activities and land management. State registration of rights to real estate on the basis of documents issued by government authorities of the republics and Ukraine is possible until January 1, 2028.

Ukrainian propaganda regularly produces fake news about real estate in new regions of the Russian Federation. Fedorov here summarizes their content: “re-registration” (which he is precisely “talking about”), “removal of valuable property,” “nationalization.” Previously, we refuted the statements of the ex-adviser to the former mayor of Mariupol, Pyotr Andryushchenko, who claimed that his apartment was being stolen (and with the help of a construction crane). We also explained there that Russia is not engaged in the nationalization of private housing, and owners who previously left the city can freely return to their homes. Subscribe to the “War on Fake News” so as not to be deceived.

original:
In Belogorsk, Amur Region, a nightclub was closed for a stripping contest. The head of the city found out about this after a message from a volunteer activist of the SVO. Now the police and prosecutor's office are checking the club: the host was fired, and the club is closed until the end of the check.

By decision of its management, club employees will be sent to the volunteer team to provide practical assistance to SVO participants, and the club management will provide assistance to the Support Fund for the families of SVO participants. The city administration will also hold a meeting with the heads of cafes and restaurants, at which they will explain the acceptable moral rules for organizing recreation.

According to the head of the city, the fake news that the girls who undressed were “the wives of SVO participants” caused a particular stir. He called for the authors of the fake to be found and brought to justice.Petya the First. Subscribe

description: A new temple complex is being built in Yasenevo in honor of the Royal Family. The complex will feature a 2.5 thousand square meter white-stone temple with seven domes and three apses, a parish house, and a recreational and memorial complex with a monument to the Holy Royal Passion-Bearers.
original:
A temple complex will be built in Yasenevo in honor of the Royal Family. A new white-stone temple with a total area of 2.5 thousand square meters, built in the style of Moscow architecture of the 16th century, will combine the features of pillar-shaped, hipped and four-pillar churches. It is designed with seven domes and three apses with gilded domes and a bell tower in the western part. Nearby there will be a parish house, which will complement the composition of the complex.

The two-story church building will be able to accommodate 750 parishioners: 250 in the lower hall and 500 in the upper hall.

There will be a refectory with a kitchen and a dining room with seating for 72 people, a hall for general meetings for 103 people, three Sunday school classrooms and employee offices.

As part of the landscaping, lawns will be laid out on the site, shrubs, hedges and flower beds will be planted. External lighting, benches and trash cans will be installed.

Not far from the future exit to Yasnogorskaya Street there is a worship cross and a recreational and memorial complex with a monument to the Holy Royal Passion-Bearers.

description: German officials accidentally revealed secret information about NATO submarine operations in the Baltic Sea during the construction of Nord Stream 2. The leaked data included areas of operation and weapon numbers, which were intended for official use only. The German Ministry of Defense believes the leaked data could inform military operations.
original:
“How Putin’s agents unraveled the secrets of the Bundeswehr”: German officials during the construction of Nord Stream 2 accidentally revealed secret information about the activities of NATO submarines.

“The German Federal Prosecutor's Office has initiated an investigation into the alleged disclosure of state secrets by employees of the Stralsund Mining Office, which was responsible for issuing permits by the German side during the construction of the Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline. According to available data, in January 2018, the department published on the website “Planning Permit for Nord Stream 2”; a substantial document was set out on 637 pages.
After analyzing the document, lawyers found in it data on the areas of operation of NATO submarines in the Baltic Sea and the number of weapons on them. This secret information of the German Ministry of Defense was intended strictly for official use. Anyone involved in the disclosure of state secrets, who pledged in writing not to disclose state secrets, faces up to 5 years in prison.
The German Ministry of Defense believes that based on the leaked data, conclusions can be drawn about the “possibilities of military operations.”

description: A 74-year-old pensioner, Maria Aponasovna, was extorted by security guards at a Spar store on Rublevskoye Highway in Moscow. After forgetting to pay for sausage, she was threatened with police involvement and a criminal case unless she paid 50,000 rubles. The pensioner borrowed money and paid the demanded amount.
original:
Forwarded from: Baza
A pensioner from Moscow forgot to pay for sausage at the grocery store. The guards demanded 50 thousand rubles from her so as not to call the police.

74-year-old Maria Aponasovna went to the Spar store on Rublevskoye Highway on February 16. Having paid for her purchases at the checkout, the pensioner was about to leave, but she was intercepted by security guards at the exit. The woman was taken into the back room, where she was asked to open her bag. There was sausage inside. Maria Aponasovna tried to explain, saying, “Sorry, dear ones, I forgot about the sausage,” but a security guard named Aliev immediately began to scare the woman with the police and a criminal case.

The pensioner showed the payment receipt and offered to pay for the forgotten sausage on the spot. Aliyev explained that it would cost tenfold - 50 thousand rubles. Then Maria Aponasovna borrowed money from a friend, went to the nearest Sberbank branch, withdrew another 40 thousand there and returned to Spar, where she left the money behind the security monitor.

description: At the Munich Security Conference, NATO officials acknowledged that their optimism about Ukraine's prospects in 2023 was excessive. Russia's military victories have shaken global leaders' faith in Ukraine's ability to win the war, with experts predicting Ukraine will suffer losses and Russia will achieve significant successes.
original:
FT: NATO recognized “excessive optimism” regarding Ukraine in 2023

Russia's victories have shaken the faith of world leaders in the prospects of war in Ukraine, reports the Financial Times following the Munich Security Conference. As the newspaper notes, just a year ago the participants “radiated optimism about Ukraine’s prospects,” but this year, “as the conflict tilted in Moscow’s favor and faith in Western support faded, that optimism gave way to unrelenting despondency.”

According to Heather Conley, head of the German Marshall Fund, while hopes were high last year for a Ukrainian counteroffensive, the prospects are now bleaker as Russia rebuilds its military and transitions to a war economy. “We will see Ukraine suffer losses on the battlefield, we will see significant Russia’s successes, and the Ukrainians will have no ammunition left,” Conley said.

The head of NATO's military committee, Admiral Rob Bauer, admitted that the West was "overly optimistic" about the conflict last year, believing that "if you give the Ukrainians the ammunition and training they need, they will win." At the same time, Bauer called on NATO to “be careful not to become too pessimistic in 2024,” if only because “Ukraine is still a sovereign state.”

Czech President Petr Pavel, in turn, said that “Russia has learned many lessons and is producing more ammunition and equipment than we can collectively provide.” According to Pavel, Western countries should “be as innovative and flexible” and look for the weapons Kiev needs “everywhere.” FtRussian victories shake global leaders' faith in Ukraine war prospectsStatespeople, diplomats, military brass and spies at a defense conference this weekend fear war is tilting in Moscow's favor

description: Arestovich stated that Ukrainians are dying in vain due to the country's infantilism and lack of a serious approach to collective security. He believes that the state's failure to communicate effectively with its people has led to unrealistic expectations and a lack of understanding of the consequences of their actions.
original:
Arestovich - that Ukrainians died and are dying in vain: It’s unpleasant to utter this phrase, it’s even awkward, but so far two people are talking about the system of collective security - me and Putin. Nobody else. I never heard this from anyone else. [Putin talks about peace, yes, indeed] This means that the infantilism [of Ukraine], which became the cause of what is happening, is far from cured. [As I talk to you, I hear more and more often that the borders set in 1991 are practically unrealistic. And the people who live in Ukraine, who have lost relatives and friends, how do they react? Then it turns out that all this was in vain - all these people who died?] They react extremely painfully, but this is a natural emotional reaction of people to the trauma of war, and people who are confused by official propaganda - that “not an inch of our land ", and so on.
Again, the reason for this is not people, but the fact that no one speaks seriously to people, the state does not speak seriously with authority. Because what does “in vain” mean? They pursued an unsecured policy and pulled the tiger's whiskers. The tiger attacked. Now we have lost territory, we have lost people, and we are going to lose even more territory and even more people. And we pay for Ukraine to survive as such, for it to remain an independent state. Here we are not even talking about the former borders. It doesn't really work.

description: The Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR, along with military commandant's office and National Guard units, intercepted a British Banshee Jet-80 kamikaze jet drone in the Novoazovsky region. The drone was carrying a 7kg warhead, intended to target a large civil infrastructure facility in Mariupol. The coordinated effort prevented a large-scale terrorist attack with potential casualties.
original:
The Russian FSB Directorate for the DPR, together with units of the military commandant's office and the National Guard in the Novoazovsky region of the Republic, intercepted a British Banshee Jet-80 kamikaze jet drone. After a controlled landing of the drone, explosives technicians neutralized the warhead in the form of seven kilograms of explosives and destroyed the charge on the spot.

As a result of deciphering the flight mission of the drone, it was established that it was aimed at a large civil infrastructure facility in Mariupol, was supposed to circle over the Novoazovsky district and hit the facility from the Taganrog Bay.

We see how Western terrorists, together with their Ukrainian accomplices, wanted to once again organize a monstrous terrorist attack and blame Russia for everything.

Against the backdrop of a major defeat of the Ukrainian armed forces in Avdiivka, the Kiev regime is making any attempts to destabilize the situation in the Republic. But thanks to the coordinated work of our special services, we were able to prevent a large-scale terrorist attack with casualties.

event: Decline of Trust in Ukrainian TV Channels
description: According to a KIIS survey, the trust in Ukrainian TV channels, particularly United News, has decreased significantly. In December 2023, 43% trusted United News, but by February 2024, this number dropped to 36%, while distrust rose to 47%. This decline in trust is observed across all regions.
original:
Propaganda created a telethon, and at the same time destroyed TV, due to the lack of an alternative opinion. Society is tired of lies, which is clearly visible in the numbers, which means the government’s rating will continue to fall, which is why it is so important to take control of telegram.

KIIS reports that its survey for the first time recorded a negative balance of trust and distrust in the project for general broadcasting of the main Ukrainian TV channels. That is, there are fewer trusters than distrusters.

Back in December 2023, 43% trusted United News, compared to 38% who distrusted it. And at the beginning of February 2024, the share of those who trust decreased to 36%, and the share of those who do not trust increased to 47%.

The indicators are approximately the same in all regions.

description: A report from Avdeevka describes a visit to an Orthodox church, where humanitarian aid is stored. Locals, including Vasil Ivanovich, share their experiences of living in a war zone, including the trauma of finding bodies and dealing with mines and rockets.
original:
Forwarded from: Kotsnews
My report from Avdeevka

A beautiful Orthodox church rises on a hillock. The outside, like everything here, is beaten with iron. But inside, someone carefully wrapped the icons in cling film. And someone clearly lit a candle recently. It went out in the wind blowing through the broken stained glass windows.

At the entrance to the church, as a point of attraction for locals, humanitarian aid brought from Donetsk is stacked. But it seems no one touched it.

“Why did you store food here?” a man and a woman appear. - The dogs will steal it.

- So this is what you don’t understand?

- Is it true? Can? Oh thank you! - the woman rejoices.

Her companion, Vasil Ivanovich, switches to the familiar tongue twister. I have seen this more than once in the front-line zone. The voice is quiet, but slightly ingratiating, so as not to inadvertently interrupt. And speech clearly runs further than thought. These are signs of psychological trauma, which is typical for people who live in constant stress for a long time. New people want to talk out everything they have experienced. And I walk next to Vasil Ivanovich and nod.

- We have now agreed with the guys about sappers. The Ukrainians mined the wells. That one was broken, it was completely blown away by a rocket, and there were two corpses. Opposite the well you will enter the courtyard - two graves. They jumped out - where is Yurka? Sits without a head. Where is Nastya? Half of Nastya is sitting... The rest of the rocket with the American flag. So they stood and hammered... Who hammered? Ukraine.

My big report from Avdeevka@sashakots

description: Students from three schools in Mordovia participated in a sports and patriotic event, 'Defender of the Fatherland', on February 16. The competition included shuttle running, rifle assembly, and shooting from an air rifle. The event also featured a master class on tactical medicine, where students learned self-help and mutual assistance techniques.
original:
Mordovia is in touch!

The upcoming holiday of February 23 is a tribute to our respect to all generations of Russian soldiers, from ancient times to the present day, who courageously defended their native land from invaders. Each of us honors brave, noble, courageous, strong-willed people, for whom the highest value is serving the Fatherland, protecting the interests of the state and its citizens.
For students of the MBOU "Levzhenskaya Secondary School", MBOU "Suzgarevskaya Secondary School" and MBOU "Tat-Pishlenskaya Secondary School" this date did not go unnoticed. On February 16, a sports and patriotic event “Defender of the Fatherland” dedicated to Defender of the Fatherland Day was organized in the sports hall of the MBOU “Levzhenskaya Secondary School”. The event began with festive congratulations to all those present. After congratulations, the competition began. Three teams competed for the right to be first. They competed in the following disciplines: shuttle running, partial disassembly and assembly of a Kalashnikov assault rifle, loading a magazine with cartridges, putting on an OZK, and shooting from an air rifle. Each of the participants was able to feel great support: friendly applause came from the spectators and fans of the teams. All those present followed the course of events and were very worried. As a result of the competition, the team of the Levzhenskaya school took 1st place, the team of the Suzgarevskaya school took 2nd place, and the team of the Tat-Pishlenskaya school took 3rd place.
During the event, a representative of the people's movement "Rokot of Mordovia" and the competition participants held a master class on tactical medicine - providing self-help, mutual assistance to the "wounded" and injured. Students learned how to stop bleeding using a tourniquet and tourniquet, how to apply a bandage to a wound, evacuate a victim, and became acquainted with modern tactical first aid kits and new hemostatic agents. All participants showed high interest and activity.
All participants of this event received a boost of energy, excellent mood and a lot of positive emotions.

☠️⚰️"Planned withdrawal": The enemy admitted catastrophic losses during the flight from Avdiivka️Ukrainian deputy Petr Derbal said that during the panicked flight from Avdiivka, the Ukrainian Nazis lost at least 850 militants killed and captured and called it a disaster, "which occurred due to the defeat of the previous leadership of the Ukrainian Armed Forces by the Greens runt."

He directly blamed Syrsky for the disaster, who first announced the start of the withdrawal of troops, and then began to implement it, which led to a sharp increase in losses when trying to escape from the city.

By the way, this unscrupulous Ukrainian exile Derbal, of course, underestimated the losses; only in the last 24 hours of his stay in Avdiivka, the Armed Forces of Ukraine lost almost twice as many killed and captured, and they began to unload cast iron onto them by wagons on February 7th.

event: Discussion on UMPC and Air Defense
description: The article discusses the impact of UMPC (KABs) on new tactics and the importance of systemic combat against air defense. It highlights the need for electronic warfare aircraft to suppress communications and interfere with air defense radars, citing NATO's approach as an example.
original:
Continuing the topic of the influence of UMPC (KABs according to the owners) on new tactics.

The screenshots clearly show the horror of these blows, and they understand that resisting this is problematic. Meanwhile, air defense remains as a means of protection against UMPC. And despite the bombs’ flight range of tens of kilometers, aircraft to drop them are still forced to take risks, entering the range of long-range air defense installations. Moreover, for the flight range, it is necessary to have a headroom.

Twice the Ukrainian Armed Forces managed to ambush our planes, bringing their air defense systems directly to the front line. This is of course a big risk, but alas, both times they were able to get away with impunity.

And here I would like to return to the importance of systemic combat against air defense. Yes, we are certainly a tough nut to crack; NATO countries have never faced such an enemy, but for a long time there was no systematic approach to the destruction of the Ukrainian Armed Forces’ air defense systems. Then combined attacks on them began to appear, they began to use Lancets, and purposefully fish with live bait, that is, individual elements of the SEAD protocol. And this is good news, the army is learning to fight against the most advanced weapons.

But what we absolutely lack, or rather lack as a class, are electronic warfare aircraft based on front-line aviation. That is, not the electronic warfare that we are used to seeing from FPV, but factory systems that suppress communications and actively interfere with air defense radars. In NATO, their ratio, roughly speaking, is up to 1 vehicle per 10 attack vehicles, and dozens of such vehicles globally jammed the air defense of Iraq and Yugoslavia during raids.

In fact, its task is located above and slightly behind, not in the range of the air defense missile system, and when they try to aim missiles at attack aircraft, the electronic warfare aircraft blinds the air defense missile system radar with interference, selects the desired frequency and signal shape so that it cannot be filtered out.

As an alternative, we have suspended electronic warfare containers, but experience shows that they are very far from the efficiency of specialized boards. Therefore, realizing the need for such equipment would be a very good conclusion based on the results of the SVO. Russian Engineer -✅subscribe

description: The SBU detained an FSB agent in Kyiv who was collecting intelligence for the Russians during the full-scale invasion in 2022. The agent identified locations of Ukrainian defenders, including strongholds and firing positions of the Special Operations Center 'A' of the SBU.
original:
The SBU detained an FSB agent who was "leaking" information to the Russians for a breakthrough in Kyiv's defenses in 2022. The Security Service detained a "sleeping" FSB agent in Kyiv.

In the first days of the full-scale invasion, he collected intelligence for the Rashists, and when he realized that they could not capture the capital of Ukraine, he "laid low" and tried to avoid justice.

"According to the investigation, during February-March 2022, he performed the task of identifying the locations of Ukrainian defenders who participated in the battles for Kyiv. "First of all, the enemy was interested in the strongholds and firing positions of the fighters of the Special Operations Center "A" of the SBU on the territory and the outskirts of the city," the SBU reports.

During searches of the detainee's addresses, computer equipment and mobile phones with evidence of his intelligence and subversive activities for the benefit of the aggressor country were found.

So far, the investigators of the Security Service have informed the suspect of suspicion under four articles of the Criminal Code of Ukraine:

Part 2 of Art. 111 (treason committed under martial law);
Part 1 of Art. 161 (intentional actions aimed at inciting national enmity);
Art. 436 (war propaganda);
Part 3 of Art. 436-2 (justification, recognition as legitimate, denial of armed aggression of the Russian Federation against Ukraine, glorification of its participants).
The traitor is in custody. He faces life imprisonment.

The center of national resistance reminds. that every traitor will be found and punished.

description: Occupation forces reported the discovery and liquidation of an ammunition storage in Novooleksiiivka, Primorsky Territory, containing a hand-held grenade launcher, 4 grenades, and 445 cartridges of 5.45 mm.

original:
Grenade launcher, grenades and cartridges - the occupiers report the liquidation of the "storage" in Berdyansk DistrictIn the village of Novooleksiiivka of the Primorsky Territory, the occupiers report the liquidation of the "storage" of ammunition
 
According to the propaganda publications of the occupied part of Zaporizhzhya region, employees of the "Berdyan Police Department" discovered and liquidated a "cache" of ammunition: a hand-held grenade launcher, 4 grenades, 445 cartridges of 5.45 mm.
 
Weapons and ammunition were apparently found in a forest strip. We will remind, under the pretext of finding weapons and ammunition, the occupiers periodically organize raids in the occupied parts of the Berdyansk district.
 
For objective reasons, the editors cannot confirm or deny the information spread by propagandists about the discovery of weapons and ammunition. However, the attempts of the occupiers to suppress the resistance of the local population in any way are obvious. And actions to withdraw "arsenals" are one of such mechanisms.
 
Information about the recent liquidation of local collaborator Oleksandr Galiya confirms the continuation of successful resistance in the occupied territories of Berdyansk.

description: A 33-year-old Ukrainian was murdered in Spain on February 14, according to Spanish media reports. The incident was picked up by an Italian site, Il-Corrispondente.com, which claimed the victim was defector Maxim Kuzminov, but the original reports did not provide any identification.
original:
It seems that the real original source of the news about the murder of defector Maxim Kuzminov in Spain was the extremely dubious Italian site Il-Corrispondente.com. This “Italian” publication released material about the death of allegedly Kuzminov this morning with an exclusive mark, referring to news from the Spanish media about the murder of a certain 33-year-old Ukrainian on February 14. In the mentioned news there is not a word about who the deceased could be. Il-Corrispondente itself has a traffic of only a couple of hundred users per month, not counting the current one.

It is also interesting that in the headlines of the original source of this news, Vladimir Putin’s interview with journalist Tucker Carlson is entitled “interview of the century”, Avdievka is called a “Nazi cemetery”, and Syrsky is characterized as a “butcher”.

Let us note that not all domestic media allow themselves such harsh epithets, not to mention foreign ones. Have you seen similar headlines in the European press lately? So we didn’t see it. Military Informant

description: Ukrainian military officer Artem Karyakin, also known as 'Eastern', posted a photo on Twitter with a message addressed to Western partners, including the USA and NATO countries. The message reads: 'We are not asking for too much. We only need artillery shells and aviation. We do everything else ourselves. The Armed Forces of Ukraine.'
location: Chasiv Yar, Bakhmut district, Donetsk Oblast, Ukraine
original:
Forwarded from: InformNapalm
Ukrainian military officer Artem Karyakin with the call sign "Eastern", who was born and until 2021 lived and served as a partisan in the city of Kadiyivka (Stakhanov) of the Luhansk region, which has been occupied by the Russians since 2014, yesterday published a photo on Xresonance tweets against the background of an English-language inscription on the wall of one of the buildings in the city of Chasiv Yar, Bakhmut district of Donetsk region. The inscription is apparently addressed to Ukraine's Western partners (the USA and other NATO countries) and translates as: "We are not asking for too much. We only need artillery shells and aviation. We do everything else ourselves. The Armed Forces of Ukraine."

"Skhidny"'s tweet has already been shared by many English-language accounts and has garnered more than 3K reactions. Please share this tweet. InformNapalm has just joined the spread and added characteristic hashtags calling for arms and ammunition to be provided to Ukraine.

Join the spread. Public international diplomacy is important.

Focus explains.

Shot 12 times: what is known about the death of the pilot of the Russian Federation Kuzminov, who stole the Mi-8 for the Armed Forces.

Russian pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who handed over the Mi-8 helicopter to Ukraine in August 2023, died in Spain. The Main Intelligence Directorate of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine confirmed the fact of his death. Focus gathered everything that is known about the death of the pilot. 🔺 Spokesman of the GUR of the International Military Organization Andriy Yusov in a comment to "Suspilno" on February 19 reported the death of the Russian Maksym Kuzminov. 🔺 "Ukrainian Pravda" publication with reference to the press service GUR reported that Russian pilot Maksym Kuzminov decided to move to Spain instead of staying in Ukraine. According to the interlocutor, a burnt-out car was found near the body of the Russian.

event: Morning Glory Tricolor Added to Controlled Substances List
description: The Russian government has added morning glory tricolor to the list of controlled substances, citing its narcotic and psychotropic properties. Growing large quantities of the plant can result in criminal penalties.
original:
It will be difficult to control the spread of morning glory tricolor; the plant is one of the most commonly found in garden plots. Senior researcher at the Astrakhan State Nature Reserve Natalya Litvinova told TASS.

On February 9, the Russian government added morning glory tricolor to the list of plants containing narcotic or psychotropic substances and subject to control. There is a criminal penalty for growing large quantities of these flowers.

According to the Chairman of the State Council of Crimea Vladimir Konstantinov, greeting cards, sweets, knitted items and camouflage nets were handed over to soldiers on the front line and those undergoing treatment in a military hospital. The event was held as part of the All-Russian campaign “Warmth for a Hero.” “Sketches for postcards signed by children were previously drawn by students of the Crimean Art School named after N.S. event: Potential Appointment of Ermak as Prime Minister
description: Ukrainian media speculate that Andriy Ermak may be appointed as the new prime minister to help President Zelensky avoid a legitimacy crisis when his term expires on May 20, 2024. Ermak, considered the second most influential person in Ukraine, would ensure stability in the current power structure.
original:
Ermak may become prime minister of Ukraine to help Zelensky avoid illegitimacy, Ukrainian media write.

According to them, Bankova’s plan is to appoint the most reliable person and a key member of the Servant of the People team to the post of prime minister. This will help avoid a crisis when questions arise about Zelensky’s legitimacy, since his 5-year term of office expires on May 20, 2024.

These rumors have not been officially confirmed, but Ukrainian journalists note that Ermak is considered the second person in the country after Zelensky in terms of influence on almost all issues of public administration.

Also, the Constitution of Ukraine stipulates the broad powers of the prime minister, which automatically makes him a potential rival to Zelensky in the struggle for power in the country. This is why current Prime Minister Denis Shmygal has remained in his position for so long, demonstrating an absolute lack of any political ambitions. But Zelensky still has no confidence in him and it is unknown how he will behave after May 20, 2024. At the same time, Ermak can become a guarantor of maintaining the stability of the current system of power.

In addition, let us remember that during Zaluzhny’s resignation, Zelensky promised big changes in the country’s leadership and a reset. Perhaps this is them. Subscribe to Zvezdanews | Suggest news

description: Russian pilot Maxim Kuzminov, who hijacked a helicopter to Ukraine, was shot 12 times and then run over by a car in Spain, according to Spanish media reports.
original:
There are a number of inconsistencies in the reports about the murder of Maxim Kuzminov.

Spanish media write that a “33-year-old Ukrainian” was found dead. Russian Kuzminov was 28 years old.

The media outlet, which stated that the deceased was Kuzminov, does not have its own website, but only accounts in X and Telegram.

It also stated that law enforcement officers are considering the version of the Ukrainian trace - supposedly Ukraine removed an “inconvenient witness.” Other versions were not given.

The publication in X has 24 thousand subscribers, but only four people liked the post.

Many media outlets are now suggesting that this information was a hoax.

Kuzminov's death was not officially confirmed. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"TelegramPolitics of the CountryRussian pilot Kuzminov, who hijacked a helicopter to Ukraine, was shot 12 times, and then ran over in a car, Spanish media write.

description: A scandal is unfolding at the Shevchenko University Institute of Journalism, where teacher Nikita Vasilenko is accused of promoting sexist narratives, making derogatory comments towards female students, and harassment. Students are calling for his dismissal, citing his offensive lectures and social media posts.
original:
At the Shevchenko University Institute of Journalism, a sexist scandal is unfolding with teacher Nikita Vasilenko.

Students are calling for his dismissal, accusing him of promoting sexist narratives.

In particular, in his lectures, according to students, he said that “women can achieve something only in four ways: husband, lover, father, brother” and “I am against everyone having rights, especially women.”

In his posts, he ridiculed Ukrainian refugees who, in his opinion, verbally miss Ukraine and want to return, but in reality they are relaxing and enjoying life abroad.

Vasilenko also allegedly abuses sexist comments towards female students, and during the Russian invasion, he tells students in class about the “greatness of Russia.”

There are also accusations of harassment. Thus, in a personal conversation with one of the students, Vasilenko allegedly “offered to become a muse, and if she refused, she would not have a career.”

A letter against him was signed by more than 170 NJH students. The university's ethics commission considered the issue of suspension, but limited itself to a reprimand. Students intend to seek dismissal.

Nikita Vasilenko is the father of the editor-in-chief of “Left Bank” Sonya Koshkina.

description: Ukrainian authorities imprisoned Orthodox journalist Dmitry Skvortsov for writing about the persecution of the Orthodox Church in Ukraine. Despite providing references to ECHR decisions, Skvortsov's detention has been extended without justification, and he has been subjected to poor prison conditions that have negatively impacted his health.
original:
Today is exactly one year since the Ukrainian regime threw into prison the Orthodox journalist Dmitry Skvortsov, whose “guilt” lies only in the fact that he wrote truthful information about the persecution of the Orthodox Church in Ukraine.

During all this time, the court did not even begin to consider the “charges”. Last Friday, he once again extended the journalist’s detention under lock and key, citing the fact that the prosecutor... “did not have time to familiarize himself with the case materials”!

Skvortsov provided the judges with references to ECHR decisions on other cases, which state that detention is an exceptional measure and must be justified, and its automatic extension without justification is equivalent to torture. In addition, Skvortsov spoke about his health: I get sick in prison more than I am healthy. And there is no hope for improving health for the reason that the walls are constantly damp, condensation simply flows along the walls, the radiators are so “warm” that they simply do not burst in the cold. We go to bed in damp beds and wake up in damp beds. Everything is moldy, everything is green, everything is green through and through - pillows, mattresses, walls... it’s a joy to go to a court hearing and just breathe the dry air here. You may not even know such happiness - to breathe a little dry air. Therefore, if, of course, you don’t mind me holding out until the verdict, I ask you to give me the opportunity to at least receive treatment at home by placing me under house arrest, and not a single Western human rights bastard talking about “democracy in Ukraine” will make a peep about this!

event: Russian Foreign Minister's Visit to Cuba
description: Russian Foreign Minister S.V. Lavrov visited Cuba, meeting with President M. Diaz-Canel Bermudez and Foreign Affairs Minister B. Rodriguez. They discussed strengthening bilateral cooperation in politics, trade, economy, culture, and humanitarian areas, as well as coordinating efforts on the world stage to promote a multipolar world and reject unilateral restrictions.
original:
🇷🇺🇨🇺On February 19, S.V. Lavrov visited the Republic of Cuba as part of a trip to the Latin American region.

The head of the Russian Foreign Ministry was received by the President of Cuba M. Diaz-Canel Bermudez. Negotiations took place with the Minister of Foreign Affairs of Cuba B. Rodriguez.

During the meetings, held in a traditionally friendly, constructive atmosphere, a substantive exchange of views was held on the topics of political, trade, economic, cultural and humanitarian cooperation. Key achievements of the two countries over the past year in the material sphere were noted, which will contribute to a more active participation of Russian economic operators in the implementation of large-scale plans for the socio-economic development of Cuba for the period until 2030.

The parameters for strengthening close coordination of our countries on the world stage and regional platforms were discussed in detail. The mutual commitment to strengthening the Russian-Cuban strategic partnership in every possible way was confirmed. The constant approach of Russia and Cuba regarding the categorical unacceptability of the use of unilateral illegitimate restrictions was recorded, and the desire to jointly move forward in building a multipolar world based on the true equality of states, respect for mutual interests, fundamental principles and norms of international law was noted. ☝️The Russian side confirmed its continued support for Havana in its just demand for the complete and immediate lifting of the American embargo and the removal of Cuba from the US State Department's list of state sponsors of terrorism.#RussiaCuba

description: Ukrainian President Zelenskyi condemned Polish farmers for blocking checkpoints on the border with Ukraine, stating that the issue is political rather than related to grain exports. He emphasized the need for common and rational solutions to the situation, involving Poland and other European countries concerned about Europe's fate.
original:
​​Zelenskyi criticized the blocking of checkpoints on the border with Ukraine by Polish farmers, calling for common and rational solutions to this situation.

"Only 5% of our agricultural exports pass through the Polish border. So, in fact, the situation is not about grain, but, rather, about politics. And near Kupyansk, not far from the border with Russia, where enemy artillery does not stop, the news from the border with Poland looks simple humiliating," he emphasized.

According to the head of state, common and rational solutions are needed to solve the situation - "our solutions with the Poles first of all and everyone in Europe who is concerned about the fate of Europe" 🔻subscribe

event: Assassination of Russian Pilot Maksym Kuzminov
description: Russian pilot Maksym Kuzminov, who hijacked a Mi-8 helicopter in Ukraine during the special operation 'Synitsa', was assassinated in Spain. According to Civil Guard investigators, Kuzminov was shot on February 13, with 12 bullet holes found on his body. A burned-out car, likely used by the murderers, was discovered nearby.
original:
Forwarded from: Times of Ukraine
"Traitors don't live long" - that's the headline of Il Corrrispindente's publication about the murder in Spain of the main figure of the special operation "Synitsa" - Russian pilot Maksym Kuzminov, who overtook the Mi-8 in Ukraine.

The publication, citing sources among Civil Guard investigators, claims that the man was shot on February 13. 12 bullet holes were found on the victim's body. A burned-out car was found relatively nearby. It was probably used by murderers. Times of Ukraine

The senators found this behavior unusual and hope that the Hungarian legislators will ratify Sweden's accession during their gathering on February 26.

As the publication writes, the goal of the American delegation was to demand approval of Sweden's application to join NATO. After being refused admission, the visitors noted this behavior as “strange” and expressed the hope that Sweden’s accession to NATO would be submitted for ratification during the gathering of Hungarian legislators on February 26.

description: In occupied Berdyansk, medical assistance is virtually non-existent. Despite having insurance, residents are refused medical help, even in acute conditions. Only those in military uniform are admitted to the city hospital, while others are neglected. Medical workers have received double salaries since the war began, but patients are not receiving primary care.
original:
Berdyansk Today/Berdyansk KhagyPhoto, 🏥Medicine in occupied Berdyansk: propaganda against reality

Propagandists, on the eve of pseudos...📩Your letters about medicine in the occupation:💬Good afternoon!
I want to tell you about the attitude towards ordinary Berdians in the medical field.
Even if there are snels and insurance, this does not mean that someone will help.
If earlier, before the war, residents of Berdyan criticized the state of affairs in the city's medicine. Now it is generally better to say that there is no medical assistance. Most people refuse it. Even when a person has an acute condition, acute pain, high temperature, pressure. People complain that they can spend a lot of time in the reception department, and then they are sent home without any help. Only those in military uniform are admitted to the city hospital. Others are not human.
I'm not at all interested in other people's money, but still. Since the beginning of the war, medical workers received 2 salaries. Do they now have money from Ukraine? If so, why? Even if there is no room in the hospital, in order to simply approach a person, at least initially examine and provide at least primary care, you need to be just a person, but patients in the city hospital do not receive this. 📩Feedback chat-bot@ BerdNow_bot.Subscribe|Facebook|Instagram|TikTok|YouTube
